channel.title: Help me with servers (not really but its a kind off a problem
channel.description:
hey i got windows and rs private servers work totally fine but i think i want to change to linux computer from www.linux.org and im asking if rs private servers are working on a linux? i mean the downloadable linux that is free :) and can anyone tell me if its: pain or any painting programm? a word and excel? a email and msn?
and do i have to do something like deleting all off my files or something?
plz help me with this and i know its not really a server help :(
help?

item.title: Help me with servers (not really but its a kind off a problem
item.dc:creator: @Kizbits2000 Kizbits2000
item.description:
@Kizbits2000 wrote:

I know this thread is old but I thought I’d put my input in since I am currently setting up my RSPS on Linux, It really does rock! It takes a bit of time to get used to the bash command line when you are used to batch, but apart from that it is stable, there are no un-needed background processes running meaning it is allot faster and a lot nicer looking…

I hated ubuntu though! I have fedora 12! You can install KDE themes onto it and they are so nice! You do have to remember that windows paths are programmed as “” in java and linux ones are “/” so you will have to edit your source a fair bit to get it all working smoothly as I just found out Lmao.

Linux OS (Fedora 12) running my server: http://www.glowfoto.com/viewimage.php?img=28-145657L&rand=9056&t=png&m=03&y=2010&srv=img6

So to sum up Linux = Excellent! Windows = Fail!

Kiz

Read full topic

and thats not good and i picked so i should have about 36GB

so can someone tell me how to get more memory at ubuntu
and im sure i have 36,3GB space again becuz that was the harddisk
i putted ubuntu on

help :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 10, 2009, 08:32:00 am[/size][hr]and i need some programs

i need vlc media

and a page where you can download stuff like games and movies free for linux

item.title: Help me with servers (not really but its a kind off a problem
item.dc:creator: @iKapa iKapa
item.description:
@iKapa wrote:

[quote=“kneistol, post:6, topic:318383”]thx to all off you and im still going to post but i think i want to quit rs servers
but thx to all off you for giving me compliments and stuff
and ollie are you serious? that linux rocks? in case I am more exited to get linux
my dad installs linux on his computer now to put it on a cd and get it installed on my computer so!!!
thx

and i wonder something? its some programms

as iKapa said there is some programms
but is there a recording programm within linux or can i use camtasia?
and is it possible to keep the bookmarks on all my webpages somewhere? or how to get onto a memory stick?

thx again :)[/quote]

Don’t quit RSPS

And I’m sure you can’t use Camtasia.

I’ll look for you.

You could try “recordMyDesktop”. Not sure how it performs and it’s quality, but here’s a link.
http://recordmydesktop.sourceforge.net/about.php

item.title: Help me with servers (not really but its a kind off a problem
item.dc:creator: @iKapa iKapa
item.description:
@iKapa wrote:

RSPS’s do indeed work on Linux. A lot of people use Linux to host their servers because it is stable.

For a “painting programm” I’m guessing you mean a graphical editing program. In which case, Linux comes with GIMP. If for some reason it doesn’t,
http://www.gimp.org/downloads/

A word or excel program, Linux comes with Open Office. If for some reason it doesn’t,
http://download.openoffice.org/other.html#en-US It includes word and excel.

AN (Add N before a vowel) email and msn should be included with Linux. If for some reason it doesn’t, download Thunderbird from Mozilla here: http://www.mozillamessaging.com/en-US/thunderbird/all.html

MSN: http://www.pidgin.im/download/ubuntu/

Remember, all these programs should be included with Linux, so do have a look around for them. Also, make sure you don’t absent-mindedly download a windows version.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Why change to a linux computer when you can install it with dual boot. Also, I think there’s a tutorial for this somewhere. Also I’m not a Linux pro or anything but if you back’d up the files you want, i.e, server files onto your pen drive (Flash drive) and put them on the Linux OS.

lmgtfy.com

LMGTFY

LMGTFY
